All Classes and Interfaces

Classes
Class
Description
ColorfulBatch
A substitute for SpriteBatch that adds an additional attribute to store an extra color's worth of channels, used to modify the L, A, and B channels of a color by multiplication (called the "tweak") while the primary color affects the color additively (just called the color, often drawn from Palette or generated with ColorTools).
ColorfulBatch
A substitute for SpriteBatch that adds an additional attribute to store an extra color's worth of channels, used to modify the H, S, and L channels of a color by multiplication (called the "tweak") while the primary color affects the color additively (just called the color, often drawn from Palette or generated with ColorTools).
ColorfulBatch
A substitute for SpriteBatch that adds an additional attribute to store an extra color's worth of channels, used to modify the intensity and chromatic channels of a color by multiplication (called the "tweak") while the primary color affects the color additively (just called the color, often drawn from Palette or generated with ColorTools).
ColorfulBatch
A substitute for SpriteBatch that adds an additional attribute to store an extra color's worth of channels, used to modify the intensity and chromatic channels of a color by multiplication (called the "tweak") while the primary color affects the color additively (just called the color, often drawn from Palette or generated with ColorTools).
ColorfulBatch
A substitute for SpriteBatch that adds an additional attribute to store an extra color's worth of channels, used to modify the L, A, and B channels of a color by multiplication (called the "tweak") while the primary color affects the color additively (just called the color, often drawn from Palette or generated with ColorTools).
ColorfulBatch
A substitute for SpriteBatch that adds an additional attribute to store an extra color's worth of channels, used to modify the RGB channels of a color by multiplication (called the "tweak") while the primary color affects the color additively (just called the color, often drawn from Palette or generated with ColorTools).
ColorfulBatch
A substitute for SpriteBatch that adds an additional attribute to store an extra color's worth of channels, used to modify the luma and chromatic channels of a color by multiplication (called the "tweak") while the primary color affects the color additively (just called the color, often drawn from Palette or generated with FloatColors).
ColorfulSprite
Holds the geometry, color, and texture information for drawing 2D sprites using ColorfulBatch.
ColorfulSprite
Holds the geometry, color, and texture information for drawing 2D sprites using ColorfulBatch.
ColorfulSprite
Holds the geometry, color, and texture information for drawing 2D sprites using ColorfulBatch.
ColorfulSprite
Holds the geometry, color, and texture information for drawing 2D sprites using ColorfulBatch.
ColorfulSprite
Holds the geometry, color, and texture information for drawing 2D sprites using ColorfulBatch.
ColorfulSprite
Holds the geometry, color, and texture information for drawing 2D sprites using ColorfulBatch.
ColorfulSprite
Holds the geometry, color, and texture information for drawing 2D sprites using ColorfulBatch.
ColorTools
Contains code for manipulating colors as int and packed float values in the CIE L*A*B* color space.
ColorTools
Contains code for manipulating colors as int and packed float values in the HSLuv color space.
ColorTools
Contains code for manipulating colors as int and packed float values in the IPT color space.
ColorTools
Contains code for manipulating colors as int, packed float, and Color values in the IPT color space.
ColorTools
Contains code for manipulating colors as int and packed float values in the Oklab color space.
ColorTools
Contains code for manipulating colors as int, packed float, and Color values in the RGB color space.
ColorTools
Contains code for manipulating colors as int, packed float, and Color values in the YCwCm color space.
FloatColors
Various utility methods for working with colors encoded as packed floats in any of the formats this can use.
GradientTools
Static methods for handling gradients of smoothly-changing colors, typically inside of FloatArrays.
GradientTools
Static methods for handling gradients of smoothly-changing colors, typically inside of FloatArrays.
GradientTools
Static methods for handling gradients of smoothly-changing colors, typically inside of FloatArrays.
GradientTools
Static methods for handling gradients of smoothly-changing colors, typically inside of FloatArrays.
GradientTools

Palette
A palette of predefined colors as packed IPT floats, the kind ColorTools works with.
Palette
A palette of predefined colors as packed HSLuv floats, the kind ColorTools works with.
Palette
A palette of predefined colors as packed IPT_HQ floats, the kind ColorTools works with.
Palette
A palette of predefined colors as packed IPT floats, the kind ColorTools works with.
Palette
A palette of predefined colors as packed Oklab floats, the kind ColorTools works with.
Palette
A palette of predefined colors as packed RGB(A) floats, the kind ColorTools works with.
Palette
A palette of predefined colors as packed YCwCm floats, the kind FloatColors works with.
Shaders
Shader code to construct a ShaderProgram that can render the specialized colors produced by the rest of this library.
SimplePalette
A palette of predefined colors as packed CIELAB floats, the kind ColorTools works with, plus a way to describe colors by combinations and adjustments.
SimplePalette
A palette of predefined colors as packed HSLuv floats, the kind ColorTools works with, plus a way to describe colors by combinations and adjustments.
SimplePalette
A palette of predefined colors as packed IPT_HQ floats, the kind ColorTools works with, plus a way to describe colors by combinations and adjustments.
SimplePalette
A palette of predefined colors as packed Oklab floats, the kind ColorTools works with, plus a way to describe colors by combinations and adjustments.
SimplePalette
A palette of predefined colors as packed RGB floats, the kind ColorTools works with, plus a way to describe colors by combinations and adjustments.
TrigTools
Various trigonometric approximations, using a lookup table for sin() and cos(), a non-tabular approximation for sinSmooth() and cosSmooth(), a Pad√© approximant for tan(), and Taylor series for the inverses of sin(), cos(), and tan().
